title: 14 Things to Know About ‘American Crime Story’ Season 3 & Versace’s Murder
text:
Lady Gaga might have a part Advertisement 
The upcoming show’s cast came up during Entertainment Weekly ’s PopFest , as a moderator pointed out American Horror Story alum Lady Gaga would make “the perfect Donatella.” 
Ryan didn’t disagree, saying with a huge grin, “Ya think?” 
We’ll take that as, “We’ve already sent her a contract.” Tensions will run high Oct 30, 2016 at 3:24pm PDT Tensions will run high Advertisement 
“I was always very moved and freaked out by the Versace assassination,” Ryan told fans at PopFest. “And I thought it was a really great story to do because it’s a manhunt season.” Season 3 will explore how serial killer Andrew “got away with being undetected.” Things might get emotional Advertisement 
Writer Ryan seems extremely connected to Versace’s untimely killing. 
“The tragedy of the Versace murder was that it should not have happened,” the producer says. “He should have been caught by then. 
“But he wasn’t caught because he was targeting gay people, and people didn’t care.” Season 3 will be ready very soon Oct 30, 2016 at 4:18pm PDT Season 3 will be ready very soon Advertisement 
Versace/Cunanan will start filming in April 2017, months before Season 2 even begins production that June. Andrew murdered at least five men in just a few months Andrew murdered at least five men in just a few months Advertisement 
Andrew, 27, went on a serial killing spree throughout the United States in 1997. 
He found his first known victim in Minneapolis before he went on to Chicago and eventually South Beach, Miami, where Versace died. 
It is suspected some of the men were friends of Andrew’s who had paid him for sex at one time. Andrew was a prostitute Andrew was a prostitute Advertisement 
The infamous criminal was a San Francisco gay gigolo — AKA a “rent boy”— before ending up on the FBI Most Wanted list. 
“He tracked possible sugar daddies with care and would say with a pout that he didn’t know whether to fly to New York or Paris for dinner,” writes Vanity Fair scribe Maureen Orth, whose book will inspire Versace/Cunanan . Andrew was obsessed with S&M porn Andrew was obsessed with S&M porn Advertisement 
Andrew’s former roommate Erik Greenman seems haunted by the man’s use of pornography. “[He] had such extreme taste in sex — S&M-wise — he’d need privacy,” Erik says. “It was way past normal. Whether it’d be whips or make him walk around in shackles—who knows?” Andrew constantly changed his appearance Andrew constantly changed his appearance Advertisement 
Versace’s murderer stayed at Miami hotel Normandy Plaza up until the Saturday before his final slaying. “I think he wore wigs,” night manager Ramón Gómez reveals, saying the young man’s hair would go from straight to curly, jet black to white, from day to day. Andrew murdered Versace in front of his home Andrew murdered Versace in front of his home Advertisement 
The 50-year-old fashion icon was opening the gate to his Miami estate when Andrew shot him twice in the back of the head on July 15, 1997, spilling his blood onto the coral-colored pavement. Versace and Andrew may have known each other Versace and Andrew may have known each other Advertisement 
A friend of Andrew’s claims he saw the killer in a San Francisco white chauffeured car with his celebrity victim and socialite Harry de Wildt. Harry, however, denies the 1990 event ever happened. Still, the FBI expects Andrew and Versace had crossed paths at some time. Andrew shot himself to death Andrew shot himself to death Advertisement 
Police began closing in on Andrew and his houseboat hideaway about a week after Versace’s murder. He committed suicide by shooting himself in the head on July 23, 1997. Police still don’t know Andrew’s motives Police still don’t know Andrew’s motives Advertisement 
It was believed Andrew began his career as a serial killer due to an HIV/AIDS diagnosis, but an autopsy proved he was HIV-negative at the time of his death. Darren Criss will play Season 3's villain Darren Criss will play Season 3's villain Advertisement 
The Glee alum will star in AHS Season 3 as serial killer Andrew. 
While the role is a huge departure from McKinley High’s Blaine, Darren couldn’t be happier, tweeting, “Needless to say, very excited and grateful to be working with my friend @MrRPMurphy again.” Edgar Ramirez will star as Versace Edgar Ramirez will star as Versace Advertisement 
Edgar will lead the show as the legendary designer. 
Although the Venezuelan actor is a Murphyverse newbie, he has starred in lots of big screen productions, including Joy , The Girl on the Train , and Matthew McConaughey’s Gold .
